content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-094-14-A
|Item_parent=Rachialgia
|Item_parent_short=Rachialgia
|Rank=A
|Title=Differential diagnosis: knowing the extrarachidian causes of low back pain
|Description=None
|Rubric=Positive diagnosis
|Contributors=Bisseriex Hélène,Nguyen Christelle
|Order=14}}

'''Extra-spinal causes of low back pain = referred low back pain'''

(of abdominal-pelvic origin)

- vascular pathology: abdominal aortic aneurysm

- urinary tract pathology: lithiasis, hydronephrosis, tumour

- digestive pathology: gastric, rectocolic or pancreatic tumour; chronic pancreatitis

- gynaecological pathology: pelvic tumour, endometriosis

- other pathologies: retroperitoneal adenopathy or fibrosis

question.title: What is an extrarachidian cause of low back pain?

option_a.title: A vascular pathology: abdominal aortic aneurysm
option_a.description: A condition affecting the blood vessels in the abdominal region

option_b.title: A urinary tract pathology: lithiasis
option_b.description: A condition affecting the urinary system

option_c.title: A digestive pathology: gastric tumour
option_c.description: A condition affecting the digestive system

option_d.title: A gynaecological pathology: pelvic tumour
option_d.description: A condition affecting the female reproductive system

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the option
